text:
VisitScotland leads golf trade mission Published on : Saturday, October 3, 2015
VisitScotland is set to lead a special mission to Tenerife to enhance the reputation of Scotland, the Home of Golf as a leading tourism destination.
The national tourism organisation is taking 19 Scottish golf b usinesses t o the International Golf Travel Market (IGTM) , the world’s premier trade event for the sport.
Team Scotland will attend the event in Tenerife from 5-8 October with partners representing a wide spectrum of the golf tourism industry including The Gleneagles Hotel, host venue of last years’ memorable Ryder Cup; Ayrshire Golf Scotland, host region of The Open in 2016 and Highland Golf Links, which includes Castle Stuart, host venue of the Aberdeen Asset Management Scottish Open in 2016.
Sure to be a highly popular attraction, the VisitScotland stand will display the world-famous Claret Jug, the trophy awarded to the winner of The Open Championship, which will be held at Royal Troon in 2016 and Carnoustie in 2018.
Over 600 golf tourism suppliers and around 350 pre-qualified buyers are expected to attend IGTM from approximately 65 countries.
Malcolm Roughead, Chief Executive of VisitScotland said:
“We are delighted to once again have such a strong Scottish presence at IGTM.This is an outstanding opportunity to drive the message to buyers around the world that Scotland is the Home of Golf and the world’s best golf tourism destination.
“We have a lot to look forward to on the sporting calendar in 2016 with The Open returning to Royal Troon among a number of world-class golf events taking place in Scotland. It is also the Year of Innovation, Architecture and Design in 2016, which lends itself perfectly to promoting golf in Scotland given our history of innovation in the game and the world-renowned design of many of our stunning courses.
“IGTM gives VisitScotland and our partners the chance to carry out hundreds of valuable appointments – meeting face-to-face with tour operators and golf businesses from around the world. We look forward to sharing knowledge and continuing our support of the burgeoning golf tourism industry ahead of another exciting year of golf in the country where it began.”
Team Scotland delegation at IGTM:
Ayrshire Golf Scotland Cameron House on Loch Lomond Carnoustie Links Fairmont St Andrews Fife Golf Partnership Golf Aberdeen City and Shire Golf Perthshire Highland Golf Links Kingsbarns Golf Links Links Golf St Andrews Macdonald Hotels and Resorts Meldrum House Hotel Muirfield Chauffeur Company ProScot Golf Ltd Scotland’s Golf Coast The Gleneagles Hotel The Open Hospitality 2016 The Village at Machrihanish Dunes Trump Turnberry
In 2015, Scotland proved it is the perfect stage for world-class golf events by hosting no fewer than nine top-class professional golf tournaments, including The Open at St Andrews and the Women’s British Open at Turnberry. This followed an incredible 2014 when Scotland welcomed the world at The 2014 Ryder Cup and the Commonwealth Games.
